page.title: 04LIFE IN SILK WILLOUGHBY
page.content: {Silk Willoughby}is a very small village two miles south of{Sleaford. It has a church, vicar and vicarage and there is also a village hall and a public house. Although the village is small there is a great community spirit. The hall is used for fortnightly whist drives, local wedding receptions and a playgroup. Villagers find employment on farms, at the{Bass Maltings}in{Sleaford}and at {RAF College Cranwell. Electricity}was installed in 1939 and{street lighting in 1946. In the 1950s the village attracted new housing. A{sewage system and{water pipes}were installed in the l960's. Although the population has expanded the amenities are fewer. The bus service runs only twice weekly, businesses have disappeared and the school closed in 1970. A car is now essential to travel to work.
